full_text: In PolicyCenter Studio, open the Submission Wizard PCF file, which is associated with the submission job. The submission wizard has dependent steps in certain orders and independent steps. Each step points to a screen. If CanEdit evaluates to true, the submission job can be edited. If CanVisit evaluates to true, the job can be viewed. A bound submission is not editable but viewable. When CountIsWork is set to true, the edited wizard can be viewed. A bound submission is not editable but viewable. The wizard step is listed as unsaved work if navigating away without saving. The title for the group of independent steps is set at the wizard level. For example, Tools. There are also other key properties for the submission wizard, such as, Info Bar. Menu Actions. Tab Bar. The entry points and variables define the signature used by other widgets to navigate to the wizard. There could be multiple signatures for the entry points. Open Account File Underscore Summary.PCF. Double-click to go to the Open Policy Transactions section. Click the Transaction Number cell. The action is set to JobForward.Go. Control-click on JobForward. Select the line of code for submission. In the action field, Control-click on Go to Submission Wizard. In Job Helper, the GoSA function calls SubmissionWizard.Go to navigate to the Submission Wizard. Log into Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Open a Submission in Draft Mode. Note the different sections in the Submission Wizard. Navigate away from the wizard without saving after a change. Click the Unsaved Work icon at the top right. The wizard step is listed as Unsaved Work because the counts as Work is set to True in SubmissionWizard.PCF. Clicking on the link takes you to the step. Locate and enforce policy. Click on the Policy link. Go to the Independent Step, Policy Transactions. Find the bound submission. Click the Bound Submission. Click the Bound Submission. Click View Policy Transactions. The bound submission is not editable. This ends the overview for JobWizard demonstration.

segments.text: In PolicyCenter Studio, open the Submission Wizard PCF file, which is associated with the submission job. The submission wizard has dependent steps in certain orders and independent steps. Each step points to a screen. If CanEdit evaluates to true, the submission job can be edited. If CanVisit evaluates to true, the job can be viewed. A bound submission is not editable but viewable. When CountIsWork is set to true, the edited wizard can be viewed. A bound submission is not editable but viewable.

The wizard step is listed as unsaved work if navigating away without saving. The title for the group of independent steps is set at the wizard level. For example, Tools. There are also other key properties for the submission wizard, such as, Info Bar. Menu Actions. Tab Bar.
The entry points and variables define the signature used by other widgets to navigate to the wizard.
There could be multiple signatures for the entry points. Open Account File Underscore Summary.PCF. Double-click to go to the Open Policy Transactions section.
The action is set to JobForward.Go. Control-click on JobForward.
Select the line of code for submission. In the action field, Control-click on Go to Submission Wizard.
In Job Helper, the GoSA function calls SubmissionWizard.Go to navigate to the Submission Wizard.
Log into Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Open a Submission in Draft Mode. Note the different sections in the Submission Wizard.
Navigate away from the wizard without saving after a change. Click the Unsaved Work icon at the top right.
The wizard step is listed as Unsaved Work because the counts as Work is set to True in SubmissionWizard.PCF. Clicking on the link takes you to the step.
Locate and enforce policy. Click on the Policy link. Go to the Independent Step, Policy Transactions. Find the bound submission.
Click the Bound Submission. Click the Bound Submission. Click View Policy Transactions. The bound submission is not editable. This ends the overview for JobWizard demonstration.
